user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_tests_run:
```c
int metal_tests_run(struct metal_init_params *params)
{
	struct metal_init_params dparams = METAL_INIT_DEFAULTS;
	struct metal_test_case *test_case;
	struct metal_list *node;
	int error, errors = 0;
	const char *dots = "..................................";
	const char *pad;

	if (!params)
		params = &dparams;

	params->log_level = METAL_LOG_DEBUG;
	error = metal_init(params);
	if (error)
		return error;

	metal_list_for_each(&test_cases, node) {
		test_case = metal_container_of(node, struct metal_test_case,
					       node);
		pad = dots + strlen(test_case->name);
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_INFO,"running [%s]\n", test_case->name);
		error = test_case->test();
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_INFO,"result [%s]%s %s%s%s\n",
		       test_case->name, pad,
		       error ? "fail" : "pass",
		       error ? " - error: " : "",
		       error ? strerror(-error) : "");
		if (error)
			errors++;
	}

	metal_finish();

	return errors;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_tests_run:
#define METAL_INIT_DEFAULTS \
{.log_handler=metal_default_log_handler,.log_level=METAL_LOG_INFO,\
}
...
struct metal_init_params {

	/** log message handler (defaults to stderr). */
	metal_log_handler		log_handler;

	/** default log message level (defaults to emergency). */
	enum metal_log_level		log_level;
}
...
#define metal_list_for_each(list, node) for((node)=(list)->next;(node)!=(list);(node)=(node)->next)
...
#define metal_container_of(ptr, structure, member) (void*)((uintptr_t)(ptr)-metal_offset_of(structure,member))
...
struct metal_test_case {
	struct metal_list node;
	const char *name;
	test_func_t test;
}
...
struct metal_list {
	struct metal_list *next, *prev;
}
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
...
int metal_init(const struct metal_init_params *params)
{
	int error = 0;

	if (_metal.common.ref_count++ != 0)
		return 0;

	memset(&_metal, 0, sizeof(_metal));

	_metal.common.log_handler   = params->log_handler;
	_metal.common.log_level     = params->log_level;

	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.bus_list);
	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.generic_shmem_list);
	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.generic_device_list);

	error = metal_sys_init(params);
	if (error)
		return error;

	++_metal.common.ref_count;
	return error;
}
...
void metal_finish(void)
{
	if (--_metal.common.ref_count != 0)
		return;

	metal_sys_finish();
	memset(&_metal, 0, sizeof(_metal));
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I report only the metal_log macro because it contains two language constructs that are documented compiler (GCC/clang) extensions: the statement-expression expression form '({ ... })' and the GNU preprocessor extension using '##__VA_ARGS__' to swallow a preceding comma for empty variadic arguments. Other fragments in the provided code do not appear to use compiler-specific language extensions: - The METAL_INIT_DEFAULTS designated initializers (e.g. {.log_handler=..., .log_level=...}) are standard C (C99 and later) and not a compiler extension. - The metal_list_for_each and metal_container_of macros are written using standard preprocessor and cast/offset arithmetic; there is no use of GNU typeof or other documented compiler-only features in the shown definitions. - Use of uintptr_t, struct initializers, for-loops, function calls, and pointer casts in the target function and additional code are standard C constructs. If additional macro/inline definitions (e.g. metal_offset_of) exist elsewhere, they should be checked separately; based on the provided code, the only explicit compiler extension occurrence is in the metal_log macro.
